website_summaries.verdict: A network card that delivers a quick, flawless performance time and time again.
pros: Easy to install and set up
Provides a high-performing, auto-negotiating Mbps connection
Delivers seamless Gigabit Ethernet over existing CAT-5 cabling
Offers a great combination of quality and affordability
Boasts on-chip voltage regulation for added safety
cons: Not intended for use with all system configurations

customer_reviews.title: Perfect matched card to play with ESXi on 1st and 2nd gen PCIE
customer_reviews.text: Needed this for creating a VMWare ESXi server as my onboard NIC was "Too commercial" to be supported. Worked out of the box with no extra configuration needed. For PCIE x1 on most boards. Note arrangement of adapter card connection to motherboard, for PCIE x1 2.0 and below, not the newer 3.0 standard.
customer_reviews.author: Woody

customer_reviews.title: it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: Works well even though it does not look as fancy as a killer nic. my onboard killer nic decided to stop working when I replaced a video card of all things. popped this guy in and back in business. unless you want a usb to ethernet adapter you will not find these types of nic cards anymore in box stores. Computer specialty stores might have them. would buy this again, and may buy another as a spare for future builds trouble.
customer_reviews.author: R. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Works Faster  than my Motherboard Integrated Realtek Card
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Choice, it works Faster than my Motherboard Integrated Realtek Card, it save me at least 1 second opening my Browsers, and on Okla taste it was more stable the connection, Very happy with the Card.
customer_reviews.author: Smart Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great Card but not the best
customer_reviews.text: A little slower than the Realtech RTL8168E and slower than the Broadcom 5751. It seems as though Intel styopped caring to keep up with ethernet chips. Slid performer, just not the fastest out there. Mediocre.
customer_reviews.author: Walter

customer_reviews.title: Works with VMWare ESXi
customer_reviews.text: I wanted this to put into my desktop Dell Optiplex 3050 that I'm running VMWare ESXi on as a second network card for a separate subnet. This card was recognized natively by VMWare ESXi and works fine. I also needed a card with a low-profile bracket so this one fits the bill perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Died, still recognized but no carrier
customer_reviews.text: Put this in my freenas box since the POS onboard realtek didn't work. Worked fine for a few weeks, even held a sustained 90Mb/s transfer of 190gb. Trying to make some changes via web interface and it stopped responding, reset the machine several time kept showing Ethernet status no carrier. Replaced it and back up and running...
customer_reviews.author: exiled350

customer_reviews.title: After changing to a half height back plate the board worked
customer_reviews.text: It loaded in my windows 10 Dell without a driver, and Ethernet connection was just fine first time out.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Bagula

customer_reviews.title: Gives full 1gb+ speed
customer_reviews.text: Grateful the card gives full speed. Install was nothing as I was replacing a card that had the same chipset. Remember the diff between Gb and GB. Roughly 1 Gb = 100 MB.
customer_reviews.author: R. Cisneros

customer_reviews.title: ESXi compatible
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for an ESXi build. My built in motherboard's NIC was not compatible, after doing some research this was a low cost solution. Works as advertised and it was plug and play. Been stable with over 21 days uptime.
customer_reviews.author: Mychal B.

customer_reviews.title: useful
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to install I installed this on a home lab VM ware machine. It is Vsphere compatible device.
customer_reviews.author: John Tran

customer_reviews.title: Very flexible card: good for Linux or Windows
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and simple to configure in both Fedora 30 Linux or Windows 10. Will get another if the need arises in the future.
customer_reviews.author: R65guy

customer_reviews.title: Mia culpa.
customer_reviews.text: I gave 3 stars. I returned the card after replacing MOBO bios allowing the use of onboard network card.
customer_reviews.author: acamus

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: After a lightning strike near my home caused loss of internet connection, my son had me order this. It came quickly and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: L. Veselka

customer_reviews.title: Works with Windows Server 2019.
customer_reviews.text: This NIC worked great with a fresh install of Windows Server 2019.
customer_reviews.author: R. Rice

customer_reviews.title: Increased speed 35%
customer_reviews.text: First, it was easy to install and worked as advertised; it increased my speed 35% which is a blessing. Great service, too!
customer_reviews.author: Swede

customer_reviews.title: Plug it in and it works. Plug-n-play under Fedora 31 Linux
customer_reviews.text: Plug it in and it works. What else can one say? Using under Fedora 31 Linux requires no drivers or extra steps.
customer_reviews.author: SetDancer

customer_reviews.title: worked well
customer_reviews.text: item was easy to install. Worked right out of the box. The only issue was the base of the face plate was a bit thicker than the room allotted to slide it in. But cant expect it to fit every desktop. I simply bent the base until it came off and then it fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Vonryanx

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great card, works perfect for Win10, no special configuration or drivers needed.
customer_reviews.author: Mark H.

customer_reviews.title: Can switch size of car support
customer_reviews.text: Installing was a breeze. Worked without putting in drivers on Windows 7.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Foster

customer_reviews.title: Not a good as an Intel chipest.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this one, but I ended up getting an Intel board.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Watson

customer_reviews.title: World of difference in Internet Quality!
customer_reviews.text: This Network Card was very easy to install and works great!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Robbins

customer_reviews.title: Plugs right in and worked
customer_reviews.text: Awesome card now my computer burns at 444 mps ....
customer_reviews.author: Mark C Gugino

customer_reviews.title: Works great, no complaints
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for an esxi server. Works great, no complaints. Would buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: ULANSeN Broadcom NetXtreme 10/100/1000Mbps Gigabit Desktop PCI-E Network Card - BCM5751 NIC
product_meta.description:
Broadcom NetXtreme 10/100/1000Mbps Gigabit Desktop PCI-E Network Card - BCM5751 NIC



Chipset: BCM5751



Specifications



 * High-performing, auto-negotiating 10/100/1000 connection
 * Easy, cost-effective migration to Gigabit Ethernet over existing CAT-5 cabling
 * Connectors: RJ-45
 * IEEE Standard/Network Topology: 10BASE-T, 100BASE-TX, 1000BASE-T
 * Bus Speed: 32/33, 32/66
 * Data Rate(s) Supported per Port: 10,100,1000 Mbps
 * IEEE Support: 802.2 and 802.3ab
 * Ethernet Controllers: BCM5751(PEG1)
 * Port Density: 1 Port
 * Standard: IEEE Std 802.3 IEEE Std 802.2 IEEE Std 802.3x IEEE 802.1p IEEE Std 802.3z

Package Including :



 * Broadcom BCM5751 PCI-E Network Adapter X 1
 * Low Profile X 1
 * Driver CD X 1
feature_bullets: Automatic Detection and Correction of Pair Swaps, Pair Skew and Pair Polarity

Network Operating Systems (NOS) Software Support: Windows* 2000; Windows* Server 2003; Windows* Server 2008; Windows Professional XP* SP3; Windows Vista* SP1; Windows 7; Linux* RHEL 4.6; Linux* Kernel version 2.6.24; Linux* Kernel version 2.4.36.2; RHEL* 5.1; SLES* 9 SP4; SLES* 10 SP1; FreeBSD* 7.0; DOS*; DOSODI*; SCO OpenServer 6/Unixware* 7.1.x; Novell Netware* 6.5; Xen*; FreeBSD* 5.x or later; ESX* 3.x* support (for VMware).

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars48 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
